decks.notes: This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and removal spells. The deck also utilizes the companion Jegantha, the Wellspring to provide additional value and consistency. The main strategy revolves around playing efficient creatures like Voldaren Epicure and Bloodtithe Harvester, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. The deck also includes some versatile creatures like Flamecache Gecko and Inti, Seneschal of the Sun to provide additional reach and utility in different situations. Overall, the deck aims to close out the game quickly and efficiently.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. By using cards like Thraben Inspector, Venerated Loxodon, and Knight-Errant of Eos, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben helps to disrupt the opponent's strategy while cards like Gleeful Demolition provide removal options. With Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion, the deck gains additional resources and flexibility. Overall, the deck is built to be fast and relentless in its attacks.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with instants and sorceries to bring back Arclight Phoenix and other powerful spells. It utilizes various cheap and efficient spells to control the board and enable the Phoenix's recursion. The key is to constantly dig through the deck with draw spells and take advantage of the Phoenix's ability to return from the graveyard to apply pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Treasure Cruise and Opt helps maintain card advantage and fuel the graveyard for powerful plays. Ultimately, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and powerful creatures.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on flooding the board with low-cost creatures and utilizing the synergy between angels like Resplendent Angel and Bishop of Wings to gain life and pump up creatures. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast and aggressive plays, while also containing disruptive elements like Skyclave Apparition to deal with threats. With a strong mana base and access to Collected Company for additional creature generation, this deck can quickly create a formidable board presence and apply continuous pressure to the opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruption spells. It combines aggressive creatures like Thieves' Guild Enforcer and Soaring Thought-Thief with removal spells like Fatal Push and Drown in the Loch to control the board and chip away at the opponent's life total. The deck also utilizes hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's strategy and protect its own creatures. The inclusion of powerful cards like Archfiend of the Dross and Nighthawk Scavenger help to close out the game quickly once the opponent's defenses have been broken down.

This deck focuses on aggressive play with a strong sacrifice theme. The key idea is to utilize cards like Witch's Oven, Cauldron Familiar, and Mayhem Devil to create a sacrifice loop that can deal damage to the opponent while generating value. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an additional layer of flexibility to the deck. By taking advantage of sacrifice effects and utilizing powerful creatures like Ygra, Eater of All, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing sacrifice synergies and removal spells to control the board while dealing incremental damage to the opponent. Cards like Witch's Oven and Cauldron Familiar create a loop of sacrificing and bringing back creatures to trigger abilities like Mayhem Devil's pings and Scavenger's Talent card advantage. Claim the Firstborn and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provide ways to steal and utilize the opponent's creatures. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive threats and resource denial tactics.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of cheap and efficient creatures and burn spells to apply consistent pressure on the opponent and finish the game quickly. It also incorporates the companion Jegantha, the Wellspring for additional value and consistency. The key strategy is to play aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Emberheart Challenger, backed up by burn spells like Titan's Strength and Kumano Faces Kakkazan, to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The deck also includes utility lands like Den of the Bugbear and Ramunap Ruins to help maintain pressure on the opponent.

The deck focuses on utilizing cheap spells and efficient card draw to quickly fill the graveyard with spells, allowing for Arclight Phoenix to be easily brought back from the graveyard. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Picklock Prankster to slow down opponents, while still maintaining a fast pace with aggressive cards like Lightning Axe. The goal is to overwhelm opponents with a combination of early aggression and recurring threats from the graveyard, creating a versatile and unpredictable playstyle.

The key concept of this UW Control deck is to establish board control and disrupt the opponent's game plan through counterspells, removal, and card draw. The deck aims to control the pace of the game, ultimately out-valuing the opponent with card advantage and finishing them off with powerful threats like Shark Typhoon or The Wandering Emperor. With a versatile suite of answers and ways to generate incremental advantages, the deck seeks to grind out victories through resource management and careful decision-making.

This deck focuses on utilizing the synergy between Greasefang, Okiba Boss and Parhelion II to create a powerful combo that can overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes cards that facilitate card draw, removal, and ramp to consistently set up the combo pieces. Additionally, there are a variety of lands to ensure mana consistency and to support the color requirements of the cards in the deck. Overall, the goal is to quickly assemble the combo while disrupting the opponent's strategy to secure victory in Pioneer 1 vs 1 matches.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Lotus Field and Arboreal Grazer, while using various untap effects to generate even more mana. The goal is to cast big spells like Emergent Ultimatum and Omniscience to overwhelm the opponent and establish a dominant board presence. The deck also includes a toolbox of cards like Fae of Wishes to search for specific answers to different situations. The strategy revolves around quickly assembling key pieces to execute powerful combos and control the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard. It utilizes various cheap spells like Sleight of Hand, Opt, and Fiery Impulse to trigger the ability of Arclight Phoenix. The deck also includes card draw spells like Treasure Cruise and Consider to dig deeper into the deck. With the combination of cheap spells, graveyard manipulation, and the powerful flying threat of Arclight Phoenix, this deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game and close out matches quickly.

The key concept of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to quickly play out aggressive creatures, such as Bishop of Wings, Resplendent Angel, and Righteous Valkyrie, while also utilizing Collected Company to instantaneously add more threats to the board. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of creatures and gain incremental advantages through lifegain and card advantage. The combination of efficient creatures, powerful combat tricks, and disruptive creatures like Skyclave Apparition make this deck a formidable opponent in the Pioneer 1 vs 1 format.

This UW Control deck aims to dominate the board through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It uses cards like Dovin's Veto and Supreme Verdict to control the opponent's threats, while Narset, Parter of Veils and Memory Deluge provide card advantage. The deck also utilizes Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion for additional value. With a mix of control elements, card draw, and powerful finishers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, this deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver its opponents in a slow and methodical manner.

The main concept of this Gruul Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Burning-Tree Emissary, while using burn spells like Play with Fire and Atarka's Command to finish off the opponent or clear blockers. The deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero by efficiently using its low-cost creatures and direct damage spells, with Den of the Bugbear and Ramunap Ruins providing additional damage sources. The deck prioritizes speed and pressure to outpace the opponent and secure a swift victory.
